BB9D08677DDA4ABE95A027DA9390305E.description: Effectively lead a meeting: provide a meeting agenda, start and stop on time, provide a clear purpose, allot sufficient time to discuss, make assignments to specific indifivuals, record decisions and assignments for follow-up.

9C531DE278C44453963424C3E75D5835.description: Proactively seek the next task to be done, and appropriately work to accomplish that task.

7825A2409D034311AE93209F189DB597.description: Demonstrate integrity and ethical behavior in using influence and power.

8B15F0B9CBC7464D82DC2F37B5E350DC.description: Listen to others’ ideas and leverage the strengths of others to accomplish a common goal.

C8299EE9CD8C4F74BB1F1A853D7C5B94.description: Be positive about others’ abilities and efforts.

439DAC1AFEC54F76A5AC8EA5A485169E.description: Expect and encourage positive personal traits and quality results from one’s self and from others.

4E229AA2BAD4480EA7485EB1CFD730E9.description: Understand how to multi-task (managing multiple projects during the same period of time).

78BC8D1923C34F98AEFF2FEC63209E88.description: Plan and prioritize tasks and work-flow to achieve desired outcomes.

4AB271F3B89045CBA85334FF23375186.description: Set and meet S.M.A.R.T. goals, even in the face of obstacles and competing pressures.

7366EDD3209847498316C81FD6AE0BE0.description:
Demonstrate how to appropriately deal with difficult individuals (client/customer, coworker,
boss, peer) by doing the following: show empathy and understanding, do not minimize the individual's problem/concern, ensure understanding by clarifying the individual's statements using appropriate questioning and listening techniques (ask open ended questions to narrow the scope of the problem, restate what is said to verify understanding, etc.), avoid arguing, provide possible solutions, and provide ways for follow-up or next steps.

57B07BF7E7E14BFA81F222D4524D9AAF.description:
Understand the role of active listening in effective interpersonal communication and
demonstrate active listening skills.

F5C6D44918944326916B493B26283FC9.description:
Respectfully accept and incorporate input and feedback from others about one’s own
work.

8EB5020000D846A2A3370B67356AC794.description:
Understand the importance of having a positive attitude while working in group
situations.

1278E0EF34B9407289A709F29DE24153.description: Proactively accept and complete assigned tasks.

A95BCFC4D2924712B15DF1C9FCA2F546.description: Actively participate and contribute in group discussions and assignments.

FF4D5843876E43E48DE7074150B58AE4.description:
Value the individual contributions of each group member and be open to new and
diverse perspectives.

ED27E709953C42C5A504CAFDAC5C40A8.description: Work effectively and respectfully with diverse teams:

8E27E1F6103F4328842E951000B76882.description: Effectively interact and collaborate with others – peers, colleagues/coworkers, employer, customers

CDDF46ECB4F644CABD4DA27F53402E25.description:
Regarding standard work-related productivity software, demonstrate competency in the basic
use of, understanding the purpose for, and determining the best software for a particular job. Focus should be given on:

9E3DD5C94C904381BB12DE560CB34F1E.description:
Conclusion (focused summary of most important parts of content, including one’s
findings, recommendation, and/or call to action)

80DF57C13FB64BD0A88885E4DB14EE47.description: Body (presentation of details related to one’s intent)

2B7DF66CB1AB43C284812A8A4E769C98.description: Introduction (quick statement of purpose and intent to entice attention)

A1856E2C65F24573B1CCA0FF01C87155.description: Apply the four basic parts of writing to any written communication. The four basic parts are:

0A0BBE0E3ED345339046B413B7B2F567.description:
Clearly and concisely communicate in writing (using proper grammar, spelling, capitalization, word choice, etc.) using the following: resume, general letter, set of instructions, basic
presentation, email, persuasive letter, business report.

DE8872F266C94FA8BE53B91CD4351801.description:
Clearly and concisely communicate verbally and non-verbally in the following situations:
formal/structured and impromptu speech, debate, collaborative discussion, and interview.

EB7E331072E941EC960D87216262633D.description: Understand and demonstrate positive and negative verbal and non-verbal communication.

F01F4BC39475458FA818B34B165B6C1F.description: Understand the intended/target audience, including an understanding of background, culture, environments, and demographics.

7EABDE3CB37B42C9B8D0EFF97B515438.description: STUDENTS WILL UNDERSTAND AND DEMONSTRATE HOW TO PRODUCE RESULTS BY DOING, RECORDING, COMMUNICATING, ACTING AND LEADING FROM INFORMATION STUDIED AND LEARNED, AND DO SO IN VERBAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATIONS, AND IN BOTH AND INDIVIDUAL SITUATIONS.

AA167F057C78484785746867CA71077E.description: Understand that every decision and action has consequences (intended or unintended).

2D944FAF21AA43BABB6C7444B5CC5596.description:
Recognize when information becomes propaganda and how it might influence beliefs
and behaviors.

B85787EF7BA64FE9833397B97DC35803.description: Apply decision-making processes appropriate to the situation and required policies.

316E4654382744E9A5C405668870C30E.description: Evaluate the gathered and analyzed information, evidence, and alternative points of view.

BDB890AF251845B4A669F3C6659814C0.description: Make effective fundamental work and personal mathematics.

150938A8B1294425B317FACEC0BB1FF9.description:
Apply fundamental works and personal mathematics including addition, subtraction, and basic algebra
to a given situation.

B886D8290D054846A9DA39A01282FA01.description: Identify and ask clarifying questions that may lead to better solutions (ex. Who will do x? What will happen if x? Where will x be located? Why will x work? When could x be done? Which x works best? How will x happen?)

DCF3BBED5A7A423B96855579DAE5C873.description: Ask questions which challenge prevailing assumptions, including one’s own assumptions and ideas.

C57BE2B24E24436E935705601AA13D66.description: Seek to understand the situation from another stakeholder’s point-of-view (i.e. a customer, colleague, etc.)

D8D334293BCC47F5A9EAA61F4F2CD868.description: Develop new ideas that contribute to a given situation using various techniques, including brainstorming and “thinking outside the box”.

79A422382E334C2B98362278CC92384F.description: Use creative thinking to solve problems.

512C91938ADD4F90B0CD62B2C09AC29C.description: Relate, infer, and apply the gathered research to the specific situation, problem or question

1A1D1C554DDA443B9831FAB7A9AB681D.description: Relate potential solutions to differnt people and situations to try and understand potential effects

596463E6D4184C22A36AE4A1434EEDB2.description: Consider the opinions of other people, times and places, different from one's own

C3D94D6836B14EABB31A32358B019592.description: Understand the true purpose and intent of solving the problem

F077417A0EAD4A16A05D5013A6A86610.description: Clearly conceptualize, document, and communicate a problem or question to be solved.

E4023F9D13B6494181A966E8FFB3B810.description: STUDENTS WILL UNDERSTAND HOW TO EFFECTIVELY RELATE, APPLY, AND ADAPT INFORMATION AND EXPERIENCES TO ANY PERSONAL, WORKPLACE, OR EDUCA TIONAL SITUA TION.

23190168F70E4E8C8C0A5A0F524643C6.description: Applied reading and interpretation skills. With minimal instruction, read, monitor, interpret, and understand information presented in various formats or tools (i.e. news articles, journal articles, charts, graphs, tables, flow charts, gauges, dials, signs, controls, etc., that may be found in various work situations.

C9DC5D2F056645C7A0126A45A3102D5A.description: Understand and apply deductive reasoning (or “deduction”) to various situations (Deductive reasoning takes a generally known rule/law and applies that rule to specific observable instances).

7D7ED6FF5BC149B9B030B47F3558E3EB.description: Understand and apply inductive reasoning (or “generalizing”) to various situations (Inductive reasoning takes specific observable instances and creates a general rule/law from those specific instances).

DDA92CB424484A79984DFE84BAC4BBD9.description:
Understand and apply the “pros versus cons” methodology to reasoning in various
situations.

005B5B74A2064AE483247BC96CC31360.description: Understand and apply the concept of “opportunity costs” to various situations.

A05A42C389A3482EA2AF9CD0051D3765.description:
Understand and apply cause and effect reasoning (or “if, then” logic) to study possible
conclusions in various situations.

933A3748F2454B6B812AD5B6871C6D25.description:
Understand and apply different reasoning methods appropriate to the situation to logically
analyze and test assumptions.

335786EFC726485BA20B5D84F960493F.description: Recognize past and current trends, patterns, or cycles in research.

4B8F4B29FB3D4E3B87BAF1FFC6902859.description: Distinguish between fact and opinion, truth and error.

962CF304E0284F498A784C6E813FC992.description: Understand how bias and ego can affect objective reasoning.

F285A1017BE6428591AAB2496C3BDC79.description: Apply critical thinking skills to objectively evaluate and analyze information.

3C9D253E5AAA4C00B3C02E8B2D428E75.description: Narrow the gathered research by categorizing it into appropriate sub-groups.

32149122FECF46B48DA0A01A84773705.description: Conceptualize and reorganize gathered information into useful forms.

9AD198FD951E44438B282B79E6D81211.description: Use technology as a tool to help organize and evaluate information.

28FE8B756C974A5BAC407C16BE5CF1BF.description: Quickly assimilate needed and relevant data from irrelevant information.

20956A39AA5F4C799659F888ACB6D3A2.description: STUDENTS WILL UNDERSTAND HOW TO CRITICALLY THINK AND OBJECTIVELY ANALYZE AND REASON THROUGH INFORMATION USING PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SOURCES, EMPIRICAL DATA, EXPERIENCE AND COMMON SENSE.

C88FF1BADBE14A34BD50A2E513DF15BD.description: Basic copyright and fair use laws.

3A3DC9BA90934EF3B704721791B5831A.description: Understand the ethical and legal issues surrounding the access and use of information, including:

979DC30E217C41A9AEEEBE04B4899720.description:
Recognize when information becomes propaganda and how it might influence beliefs
and behaviors.

68FB5F897BA7432799990C9BD7B4C06E.description: Recognize bias or spin within the messages presented.

C279963BD43440E9A6A92C13E7CA0125.description: Understand how and why (for what purposes) different information (messages, content, media, advertising, research, etc.) is developed and presented.

B2F99B2254284827AAA5AE261C729ACE.description: Discern between relevant and credible sources versus irrelevant and questionable sources.

87B2434B683F4A708CB01F9D4954FBCC.description: Understand the difference between quantitative and qualitative information.

DF7F1F85527446369FE8BC2B5680F61A.description: Differentiate between primary, secondary and tertiary sources, and understand the basic pros and cons of each source type.

3BA71C9EDC66403980C6E91A8140D39B.description: Community and industry groups, associations, publications, and businesse

B1040355A35E4856A764C3EDF7353A5D.description: Different browsers and search engine results

781FD4A5F6A44C30B1F10869D6169F72.description: Locate and gather relevant information in printed and digital formats from various sources, including:

32563EB5CE31497CAFCEB584ED42C45E.description: Information Literacy – gathering and discerning relevant information.

7372E7AA6A1F46CE959DD51ED584BDF1.description: Understand how and when to use the following questioning strategies: yes and No questions, probing questions, leading questions and rhetorical questions.

6D7CCCC372C44738B6C8AEE38B39B087.description: Properly use interrogative questions to research the needed information (who, what, where, why, when, which, how).

BE6B681710E84136829E819404A0C6BF.description: Ask relevant and pertinent (i.e. “right”) questions to focus research efforts given a specific situation.

C1A16584AB02442D94318F615B22A6F5.description: Developing and asking the right questions.

8A7D10D050E342E9A33A1728C75AAB7B.description: STUDENTS WILL UNDERSTAND AND DEMONSTRATE HOW TO SEARCH FOR AND LOCATE INFORMATION FOR ANY GIVEN SUBJECT. UNDERSTAND THAT RESEARCH IS AN INTEGRAL PART OF EVERYDAY LIFE AND WORK, AND THAT EFFECTIVE RESEARCH SKILLS ENHANCE WORK AND PERSONAL LIFE.

50385F41FDAB47E2A4424F298AC60211.description: Dresses and acts appropriately for the situation.

8242932D9E4143AD95B20C98C6B11A46.description: Resourcefully produces results regardless of challenges or tedious tasks.

92110F62F0E24E6C9EDE99BCA635E077.description: Works hard at any given task – has good work ethic.

7FEFD59A98A94377812D9E34E73CBBD6.description: Is adaptable and flexible to change and setbacks.

467A5BAF26E742E6A9EC0A7E59CA7741.description: Demonstrates eagerness for self-improvement and continues to be a self-directed learner professionally and personally.

C3B577B412C14E9ABFC58397E3CEF743.description: Shows respect for others and others’ time and possessions (including your coworkers and employer, and personal time vs. work time).

83E35250A9064E4F94484D2867E6A576.description: Is dependable in all situations, including regular and on-time attendance, and completing assigned tasks on-time.

BD80A345494E4F7B9EC9B982E782976B.description: Is helpful and finds ways to provide value.

911765A47A0D42279EF76BD68D533A4E.description: Deals honestly and with integrity in all situations

23AA18CAD9584594A7014DF14066A6ED.description: Is self-motivated and self-disciplined, and can work and think independently.

1325A808A0C7494A8FB763ECB0BE4D6B.description: Presents a positive attitude about work, learning, challenges, and about other people.

52701CF444324A298F76C2E91A7BA940.description: STUDENTS WILL UNDERSTAND AND DEMONSTRATE THE PERSONAL TRAITS THAT ENCOURAGE PRODUCTIVITY, QUALITY WORK, SELF-INITIA TIVE, AND EMPLO Y ABILITY. APPLIES PERSONAL TRAITS TO ALL SITUATIONS. UNDERSTAND THAT THESE TRAITS MUST BE PRACTICED AND DEVELOPED.
